wtsproc.config: This unit had A/C. It was not necessary to evacuate and remove the condenser. The condenser mounting bolts were removed along with line support/routing clamps, and the condenser was then repositioned for access to the charge air cooler and radiator.

step1.para: Chock wheels. Open hood.
Disconnect hood support cables; allow hood to rest on support stand.
Drain cooling system.
Remove bug screen to provide access to A/C condenser.
Remove A/C condenser mounting bolts and line support clamps.
Remove air recirculation shields from both sides of charge air cooler; include ground wire at bottom of radiator.
Disconnect charge air cooler pipes from charge air cooler.
Reposition A/C condenser and secure to right side of engine.
Remove radiator hose from left side.
Remove bolts retaining charge air cooler and remove charge air cooler from chassis.
Remove radiator hose from right side.
Remove lower radiator support bolts.
Remove wire harness clamp at radiator frame.
Remove radiator support strut rods.
Position and attach lifting device to radiator assembly and remove radiator from chassis.
Remove radiator/tank assy. From radiator frame, remove shroud, frame sides and ground wire.
Transfer fittings to new radiator.
Install new radiator into radiator support frame. Install shroud, frame sides, and ground wire.
Install radiator lifting device.
Position radiator assembly into chassis (2 people).
Install radiator support struts.
Secure wire harness clamp at radiator frame.
Install lower radiator support bolts.
Install radiator hose to right side of radiator.
Position charge air cooler and secure with retaining bolts.
Connect charge air cooler pipes to charge air cooler.
Install radiator hose to left side of radiator.
Reposition A/C condenser from right side of engine to its mounting location in front of the charge air cooler.
Install air recirculation shields to both sides of charge air cooler; include ground wire at bottom of radiator.
Secure A/C condenser by installing mounting bolts; position and secure line support clamps.
Install bug screen.
Fill cooling system.
Pressure check cooling system and check for leaks.
Connect hood support cables.
Close hood and remove wheel chocks.
